summary: The CFPB Budget Integrity Act (H.R. 3141) aims to limit the unobligated balances held by the Bureau of Consumer Financial Protection (CFPB). It proposes amending the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 to cap the CFPB's unobligated balances at 5% of a specified dollar amount and mandates that any excess funds be transferred to the Treasury's general fund. Additionally, the bill requires a report detailing the use of unobligated balances.
